name: Cat Investor
description:
In 2013 a cat named Orlando beat financial experts in stock-picking. Could you beat him?   Each turn he “rolls the dice” and invests in one of the 6 companies on the market. He also has a big starting advantage!  You have access to the news. Read them carefully to understand where the market is going to go!  

INSTRUCTION (Please read!):

Read the news. Make assumptions based on them. Ask the question "Which stock will go up given these news?" Then act! For example, if government wants to buy tablets for schools, that will make the stock of the company connected to it (Twenty Two Electronics) more valuable in the next turn!

PORTFOLIO Money on-hand

                              Invested money (+??%)

COMPANY STOCK                                                                                                       BUY

BOUGHT STOCK AMOUNT (WORTH)      STOCK PRICE (+??%)     SELL

Companies:

Edible Foods - food

Bignack Property Group - building & construction

Energy Red - energy company

Joshua-Watson Oil - fossil fuels

Outstanding Electric Motors - electric automobiles

Twenty Two Electronics - high-tech & electronics

KNOWN PROBLEMS:

If you have 1 stock, slide the slider all the way to the other side to select it

Mark Hanna: “Number one rule of Wall Street: Nobody - I don't care if you're Warren Buffett or Jimmy Buffett - Nobody knows if the stock's going to go up, down, sideways, or in f$!?ing circles.”  

Music used: Arcade Music Loop.wav by joshuaempyre (CC BY 3.0, URL: https://freesound.org/s/251461/)
